Georgia: s current law prohibits breweries from selling directly to consumers, which puts them at a competitive disadvantage both regionally and nationally.
The craft beer industry in Georgia has b: 3. The Brewers Association estimates that 207,000 barrels of craft beer were produced in Georgia in 2013, contributing $671 million to Georgia's economy.
Georgia is one of only five states: along with West Virginia, Hawaii, Mississippi, and North Dakota, that have laws prohibiting direct sales by breweries to consumers.
